body_content.explanation: a name used mainly in the 1980s for a condition in which someone, especially a child, is often in a state of activity or excitement and unable to direct their attention towards what they are doing:
examples: He was told he had attention deficit disorder after repeatedly getting into trouble at school.
A person with ADHD, previously known as attention-deficit disorder (ADD), has trouble focusing on activities, organizing and finishing tasks, and following instructions.
